attribute_information.CollegeColor: Hex color code used to color nodes based on college affiliation.
attribute_information.CollegeName: Name of the college affiliated with the author.
attribute_information.DOI: One or more DOIs of the datasets contributed to by the author, separated by semicolons.
attribute_information.DepartmentColor: Hex color code for department-level node coloring.
attribute_information.DepartmentName: Name of the department or research unit.
attribute_information.id: Unique identifier for the node (used to construct graph edges).
attribute_information.label: Name of the author or research group. Used as the node label in the network.
attribute_information.node_group: Constant value \"Authors\" identifying this as an author node type.
attribute_information.study_count: Number of datasets (studies) the author is associated with.
attribute_information.title: Tooltip showing study count and year range for hover info in the network plot.
attribute_information.year_range: Range of publication dates (earliest to latest) across all studies linked to the author.

meta.description: The authors_node dataset is part of the RED-X application\'s network visualization layer. It represents author nodes in the research network, where each row corresponds to an individual author or research group identified in the study metadata. The dataset includes details such as the author name, the number of studies they contributed to, associated departments and colleges, color assignments for visualization, and the range of years during which their work was published. This dataset enables users to interactively explore the relationships and collaboration patterns among authors across different departments and institutions.
meta.name: Authors Nodes
